params.name: xmin
params.description: Lower x bound of the grid

params.name: xmax
params.description: Upper x bound

params.name: ymin
params.description: Lower y bound

params.name: ymax
params.description: Upper y bound

params.name: nx
params.description: Number of bins along x axis

params.name: ny
params.description: Number of bins along y axis

NaiveBroadphase.name: NaiveBroadphase
NaiveBroadphase.description: Naive broadphase implementation. Does N^2 tests.

DistanceConstraint.name: DistanceConstraint
DistanceConstraint.description: Constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.
DistanceConstraint.author: schteppe

params.name: dist
params.description: The distance to keep between the bodies.

params.name: bi
params.description: First body participating in the equation

params.name: bj
params.description: Second body participating in the equation

params.name: minForce
params.description: Minimum force to apply. Default: -1e6

params.name: maxForce
params.description: Maximum force to apply. Default: 1e6

FrictionEquation.name: FrictionEquation
FrictionEquation.description: Constrains the slipping in a contact along a tangent

PointToPointConstraint.name: PointToPointConstraint
PointToPointConstraint.description: Connects two bodies at given offset points
PointToPointConstraint.author: schteppe

params.name: pivotA
params.description: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyA which bodyA is constrained to.

params.name: bodyB
params.description: Body that will be constrained in a similar way to the same point as bodyA. We will therefore get sort of a link between bodyA and bodyB. If not specified, bodyA will be constrained to a static point.

params.name: pivotB
params.description: See pivotA.

params.name: maxForce
params.description: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

mat2.name: mat2
mat2.description: The mat2 object from glMatrix, extended with the functions documented here. See http://glmatrix.net for full doc.

vec2.name: vec2
vec2.description: The vec2 object from glMatrix, extended with the functions documented here. See http://glmatrix.net for full doc.

Body.name: Body

props.name: shape
props.description: Used for collision detection. If absent the body will not collide.

props.name: mass
props.description: A number >= 0. If zero, the body becomes static. Defaults to static [0].

todo: Should not take mass as an argument to Body
but as density to each Shape

Plane.name: Plane
Plane.description: Line shape class. The line shape is along the x direction, and stretches from [-length/2, 0] to [length/2,0].

params.name: vertices
params.description: An array of Float32Array vertices that span this shape. Vertices are given in counter-clockwise (CCW) direction.

Spring.name: Spring
todo: Should have anchor points in the bodies

IslandSolver.name: IslandSolver
IslandSolver.description: Splits the system of bodies and equations into independent islands

Island.name: Island
Island.description: An island of bodies connected with equations.

World.name: World
World.description: The dynamics world, where all bodies and constraints lives.

classitems.description: Nearphase for particle vs plane

params.name: bi
params.description: The particle body

params.name: si
params.description: Particle shape

params.name: xi
params.description: World position for the particle

params.name: ai
params.description: World angle for the particle

params.name: bj
params.description: Plane body

params.name: sj
params.description: Plane shape

params.name: xj
params.description: World position for the plane

params.name: aj
params.description: World angle for the plane

classitems.description: Check whether a circle and a plane collides. See nearphaseCirclePlane() for param details.

params.name: result
params.description: The Bodies will be pushed into this array if they collide.

classitems.description: Creates ContactEquations and FrictionEquations for a collision.

params.name: circleBody
params.description: The first body that should be connected to the equations.

params.name: circleShape
params.description: The circle shape participating in the collision.

params.name: circleOffset
params.description: Extra offset to take into account for the Shape, in addition to the one in circleBody.position. Will *not* be rotated by circleBody.angle (maybe it should, for sake of homogenity?). Set to null if none.

params.name: planeBody
params.description: The second body that should be connected to the equations.

params.name: shapeB
params.description: The Plane shape that is participating

params.name: planeOffset
params.description: Extra offset for the plane shape.

params.name: planeAngle
params.description: Extra angle to apply to the plane

params.name: result
params.description: Resulting ContactEquations will be pushed into this array

params.name: oldContacts
params.description: Reusable ContactEquations

params.name: doFriction
params.description: Whether to create FrictionEquations

params.name: frictionResult
params.description: Resulting FrictionEquations will be pushed into this array

params.name: oldFrictionEquations
params.description: Reusable FrictionEquation objects

params.name: slipForce
params.description: To be passed to created FrictionEquations

return.description: True if we created any Equations.

classitems.description: Get all potential intersecting body pairs.
classitems.name: getCollisionPairs

params.name: world
params.description: The world to search in.

return.description: An array of the bodies, ordered in pairs. Example: A result of [a,b,c,d] means that the potential pairs are: (a,b), (c,d).

classitems.description: Get the colliding pairs
classitems.name: getCollisionPairs

classitems.description: First body participating in the constraint.

classitems.name: bodyB

classitems.description: To be implemented by subclasses. Should update the internal constraint parameters.

classitems.name: setSlipForce

classitems.description: Get the vector x component

classitems.description: Get the vector y component
classitems.name: getY

classitems.description: Make a cross product and only return the z component

classitems.description: Cross product between a vector and the Z component of a vector
classitems.name: crossVZ

classitems.description: Cross product between a vector and the Z component of a vector
classitems.name: crossZV

classitems.description: Rotate a vector by an angle

classitems.description: The body identifyer

classitems.description: The shapes of the body.

classitems.description: The body-local shape angle transformations.

classitems.description: The mass of the body.
classitems.name: mass

classitems.name: invMass

classitems.description: The inertia of the body around the Z axis.
classitems.name: inertia

classitems.description: The inverse inertia of the body.

classitems.description: The position of the body

classitems.description: The velocity of the body

classitems.description: Constraint velocity that was added to the body during the last step.

classitems.name: motionState

classitems.description: Add a shape to the body

classitems.description: Updates .inertia, .invMass, .invInertia for this Body. Should be called when changing the structure of the Body.
classitems.name: updateMassProperties

classitems.description: Apply force to a world point. This could for example be a point on the RigidBody surface. Applying force this way will add to Body.force and Body.angularForce.
classitems.name: applyForce

params.name: force
params.description: The force to add.

params.name: worldPoint
params.description: A world point to apply the force on.

classitems.description: Dynamic body.

classitems.description: Static body.
classitems.name: STATIC

classitems.description: Kinematic body.

classitems.description: Should return the moment of inertia around the Z axis of the body given the total mass. See Wikipedia's list of moments of inertia.
classitems.name: computeMomentOfInertia

return.description: If the inertia is infinity or if the object simply isn't possible to rotate, return 0.

classitems.description: The radius of the circle.

classitems.description: The contacts in the world that were generated during the last step().

classitems.description: Gravity in the world. This is applied on all bodies in the beginning of each step().
Whether to do timing measurements during the step() or not.
classitems.name: doPofiling

classitems.description: How many millisecconds the last step() took. This is updated each step if .doProfiling is set to true.
classitems.name: lastStepTime
